title: Google\Cloud\Run\V2\ExecutionTemplate
name: ExecutionTemplate
description:
ExecutionTemplate describes the data an execution should have when created from a template.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.run.v2.ExecutionTemplate

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.parallelism
params.description: Specifies the maximum desired number of tasks the execution should run at given time. Must be <= task_count. When the job is run, if this field is 0 or unset, the maximum possible value will be used for that execution. The actual number of tasks running in steady state will be less than this number when there are fewer tasks waiting to be completed remaining, i.e. when the work left to do is less than max parallelism.

params.name: data.task_count
params.description: Specifies the desired number of tasks the execution should run. Setting to 1 means that parallelism is limited to 1 and the success of that task signals the success of the execution. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

params.name: data.template
params.description: Required. Describes the task(s) that will be created when executing an execution.

methods.name: getParallelism
methods.description:
Specifies the maximum desired number of tasks the execution should run at given time. Must be <= task_count.

When the job is run, if this field is 0 or unset, the maximum possible value will be used for that execution. The actual number of tasks running in steady state will be less than this number when there are fewer tasks waiting to be completed remaining, i.e. when the work left to do is less than max parallelism.
